page.title: 03Four Oaks Language
page.content: There are very few ethnic minority groups,consequently languages other than English are seldom if ever heard. Because of the residential nature of the area, the people who live here have frequently moved into the district, almost always for occupational reasons.There is also much fluidity of movement , both in and out of the area, thus a variety of regional accents and dialects can be heard, although these have inevitably been modified by the use of so called standard English as heard on the television and the radio. The Birmingham accent which is associated with the Black Country dialect is not popular with many people because it is not as socially acceptable as other regional variations in speech and vocabulary and a great many parents and schools actively discourage it.
